label: Cézar
name: Cézar
biographical_notes: Runaway, attended dinners at Louison’s cabin, friend of Louis dit Föy.

label: Louis
name: Louis
biographical_notes: Thirty-five years old (in 1764); of the Bambara nation. Enslaved to Sir Blevin of Illinois. Testified that he had arrived in Louisiana from Saint Domingue. Friend of Cezar (#kl103). Attended dinners at Louison’s (#kl122) cabin.

label: Louison
name: Louison
biographical_notes: Fifty-four years old (in 1764), of the Mandinga nation; lives in a cabin in the garden of her enslaver, Cantrelle. Friend of Julie dit Comba. Louison often cooked meals for her friends and kin.

label: Fatima
name: Fatima
biographical_notes: Enslaved by de Lafreniere; Helped cook dinner at Louison’s cabin.

label: A group of Bambara people
name: A group of Bambara people
biographical_notes: A group with whom Mama Comba visited while looking for Louison one day in Cantrelle's garden around the time when she met Louis.

label: Biron
name: Biron
biographical_notes: "originating from the cargo of the ship L’Aurore" from Senegambie, Biron had been living in the US for two years, during this time he had successfully made Marronage many times.  When he ran away in 1728, he was pursued by his enslaver, Jean Sougaine, who almost killed him while trying to recapture him.

label: Samba Bambara
name: Samba Bambara
biographical_notes: "Samba, Bambara Christian", is an enslaved translator of Biron (who does not speak French). Biron made an oath to report faithfully to [court] the answers of the said Biron on the questions [they] asked of him.

label: Biron
name: Biron
biographical_notes: "originating from the cargo of the ship L’Aurore" from Senegambie, Biron had been living in the US for two years, during this time he had successfully made Marronage many times.  When he ran away in 1728, he was pursued by his enslaver, Jean Sougaine, who almost killed him while trying to recapture him.

label: A group of enslaved people
name: A group of enslaved people
biographical_notes: A group of people enslaved on Soubaigne's plantation who informed Soubaigne of Biron's absence
